newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day Cetes rate falls on cash surplus.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day Cetes rate falls on cash surplus.

text.p: Mexico's same-day Cetes rate closed lower on the secondary money market on Wednesday, reversing initial rises when an excess of cash in the market bid up prices, dealers said.
Same-day Cetes fell 40 basis points to 23.50 points, this after Tuesday's close was the lowest rate in 19 months.

"They (banks, financial institutions) had a lot of money and tried to speculate by selling off some paper to push rates up, but it didn't work and they had to cover their positions ...," one said. Rates on bank notes and acceptances fell 60 basis points to 25.40 percent, the lowest of the session.
